summary: Build a Phase 10 game scorecard app supporting up to 10 players with manual per-round score entry, phased yes/no tracking, automatic phase advancement, phase-requirements pop-up per player's next phase, and game-end logic when someone completes Phase 10 (lowest score wins; ties share first place).
architectural_notes: Score entry is manual (no card-by-card scoring); each round records score + phased boolean per player.
Phase progression is automatic and strictly ordered; advance only when phased=true for that round.
Game ends at end of a round once any player completes Phase 10; if multiple complete Phase 10 that round, winner still based on lowest total score.
End-of-game view shows final total scores and final phase per player only (no round list).
Ties for lowest total score are allowed; declare all tied players as winners.
Phase requirements are displayed via a pop-up for the current player's next phase only.

existing_features.title: Update the game-end result model to support multiple winners (a tie) instead of only a single `winner`, and ensure the scoring utilities can return all tied players when applicable.

Update the game-over UI on the score sheet to correctly display ties for first place: if multiple winners are returned, show all tied player names and indicate they are tied for first place with the winning score.

new_feature_requests.summary: Phase 10 scorecard: support up to 10 players (add/manage players)
Round-by-round entry: manually enter each player's score and phased (yes/no) per round
Automatic phase tracking: advance a player to the next phase when marked as phased for the round (phases advance strictly in order)
Game end: end at end of round when any player completes Phase 10; show final scores and final phases only
Winner determination: lowest total score wins; if tie for lowest, all tied players share first place
Phase requirements UI: show current player's next phase requirements in a pop-up (similar to rules pop-up)

projectName: Support shared first place when winners tie on score
